title: py-numpy seems to need F90 compiler
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
spack install py-numpy ~blas ~lapack

==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.6/bin/python3.6' '-s' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'build'
2 errors found in build log:
     229    nagfor: no Fortran 90 compiler found
     230    don't know how to compile Fortran code on platform 'posix'
     231    C compiler: /home/travis/.cache/spack/lib/spack/env/clang/clang -Wn
            o-unused-result -Wsign-compare -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O3 -Wall -g -fs
            tack-protector --param=ssp-buffer-size=4 -Wformat -Werror=format-se
            curity -fPIC
     232    
     233    compile options: '-Inumpy/core/src/private -Inumpy/core/src -Inumpy
            /core -Inumpy/core/src/npymath -Inumpy/core/src/multiarray -Inumpy/
            core/src/umath -Inumpy/core/src/npysort -I/opt/python/3.6.7/include
            /python3.6m -c'
     234    clang: _configtest.c
  >> 235    /home/travis/.cache/spack/lib/spack/env/clang/clang: line 523: /usr
            /local/clang-6.0.0/bin/clang: No such file or directory
  >> 236    /home/travis/.cache/spack/lib/spack/env/clang/clang: line 523: /usr
            /local/clang-6.0.0/bin/clang: No such file or directory
     237    failure.
     238    removing: _configtest.c _configtest.o
     239    Running from numpy source directory.
     240    /tmp/travis/spack-stage/spack-stage-0xccmjk2/numpy-1.15.2/numpy/dis
            tutils/system_info.py:625: UserWarning:
     241        Atlas (http://math-atlas.sourceforge.net/) libraries not found.
     242        Directories to search for the libraries can be specified in the
```

### Platform and user environment

Travis with "Ubuntu Xenial" image and clang 6

- `packages.yaml`: https://github.com/openPMD/openPMD-api/pull/444
- `compilers.yaml`: https://github.com/openPMD/openPMD-api/pull/444

### Additional information

I am compiling a software stack for CI on travis an it looks to me that the recent numpy 1.15.2 requires some kind of Fortran compiler, although I don't build BLAS backends.
